subject: Technology
title: Echo Chambers: Only Hearing What You Believe
description: One-minute skill: Echo Chambers: Only Hearing What You Believe.

hook.text: People on opposite sides of a political issue see completely different realities on the same platform.

buildup.text: Algorithms show you content you agree with because agreement keeps you engaged. Disagreement makes you leave.

discovery.text: Over time, your feed reinforces your existing beliefs. Opposing views disappear, and your position feels like everyone's.

twist.text: Research shows people in echo chambers become more extreme. Without opposing views, moderate positions erode.

climax.text: Echo chambers don't just divide opinions. They divide reality itself. Two people can no longer agree on basic facts.

punchline.text: The algorithm shows you what you want to hear. That's the problem.

quiz.question: What happens to people's views inside echo chambers?
options: They become more extreme over time
